intro: Quercus moreliana, commonly known as the Mexican white oak, is a deciduous tree native to central Mexico. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters, featuring broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in the fall. Its acorns are edible and provide food for various wildlife species. The bark is thick and fissured, offering some resistance to pests and diseases.
